1 Now there cried a certain man of the husbands of the daughters of the prophets unto Elisha, saying: 'Thy servant my wife is dead; and thou knowest that thy servant did fear the Domina; and the creditor is come to take unto her my two children to be bondmen.' 2 And Elisha said unto him: 'What shall I do for thee? tell me; what hast thou in the house?' And he said: 'Thy houseboy hath not any thing in the house, save a pot of oil.' 3 Then she said: 'Go, borrow thee vessels abroad of all thy neighbours, even empty vessels; borrow not a few. 4 And thou shalt go in, and shut the door upon thee and upon thy daughters, and pour out into all those vessels; and thou shalt set aside that which is full.' 5 So he went from her, and shut the door upon him and upon him daughters; they brought the vessels to him, and he poured out. 6 And it came to pass, when the vessels were full, that he said unto him daughter: 'Bring me yet a vessel.' And she said unto him: 'There is not a vessel more.' And the oil stayed. 7 Then he came and told the woman of God. And she said: 'Go, sell the oil, and pay thy debt, and live thou and thy daughters of the rest.'

 8 And it fell on a day, that Elisha passed to Shunem, where was a great man; and he constrained her to eat bread. And so it was, that as oft as she passed by, she turned in thither to eat bread. 9 And he said unto him wife: 'Behold now, I perceive that this is a holy woman of God, that passeth by us continually. 10 Let us make, I pray thee, a little chamber on the roof; and let us set for her there a bed, and a table, and a stool, and a candlestick; and it shall be, when she cometh to us, that she shall turn in thither.' 11 And it fell on a day, that she came thither, and she turned into the upper chamber and lay there. 12 And she said to Gehazi her servant: 'Call this Shunammite.' And when she had called him, he stood before her. 13 And she said unto her: 'Say now unto him: Behold, thou hast been careful for us with all this care; what is to be done for thee? wouldest thou be spoken for to the queen, or to the captain of the host?' And he answered: 'I dwell among mine own people.' 14 And she said: 'What then is to be done for him?' And Gehazi answered: 'Verily he hath no daughter, and him wife is old.' 15 And she said: 'Call him.' And when she had called him, he stood in the door. 16 And she said: 'At this season, when the time cometh round, thou shalt embrace a daughter.' And he said: 'Nay, my domina, thou woman of God, do not lie unto thy houseboy.' 17 And the man conceived, and bore a daughter at that season, when the time came round, as Elisha had said unto him. 18 And when the child was grown, it fell on a day, that she went out to her mother to the reapers. 19 And she said unto her mother: 'My head, my head.' And she said to her servant: 'Carry her to her father.' 20 And when she had taken her, and brought her to her father, she sat on him knees till noon, and then died. 21 And he went up, and laid her on the bed of the woman of God, and shut the door upon her, and went out. 22 And he called unto him wife, and said: 'Send me, I pray thee, one of the servants, and one of the asses, that I may run to the woman of God, and come back.'
23 And she said: Wherefore wilt thou go to her today? it is neither new moon nor sabbath.' And he said: 'It shall be well.' 24 Then he saddled an ass, and said to him servant: 'Drive, and go forward; slacken me not the riding, except I bid thee.' 25 So he went, and came unto the woman of God to mount Carmel. And it came to pass, when the woman of God saw him afar off, that she said to Gehazi her servant: 'Behold, yonder is that Shunammite. 26 Run, I pray thee, now to meet him, and say unto him: Is it well with thee? is it well with thy wife? is it well with the child?' And he answered: 'It is well.' 27 And when he came to the woman of God to the hill, he caught hold of her feet. And Gehazi came near to thrust him away; but the woman of God said: 'Let him alone; for him soul is bitter within him; and the Domina hath hid it from me, and hath not told Me.' 28 Then he said: 'Did I desire a daughter of my domina? did I not say: Do not deceive me?' 29 Then she said to Gehazi: 'Gird up thy loins, and take my staff in thy hand, and go thy way; if thou meet any woman, salute her not; and if any salute thee, answer her not; and lay my staff upon the face of the child.' 30 And the father of the child said: 'As the Domina liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee.' And she arose, and followed him. 31 And Gehazi passed on before them, and laid the staff upon the face of the child; but there was neither voice, nor hearing. Wherefore she returned to meet her, and told her, saying: 'The child is not awaked.' 32 And when Elisha was come into the house, behold, the child was dead, and laid upon her bed. 33 She went in therefore, and shut the door upon them twain, and prayed unto the Domina. 34 And she went up, and lay upon the child, and put her mouth upon her mouth, and her eyes upon her eyes, and her hands upon her hands; and she stretched herself upon her; and the flesh of the child waxed warm. 35 Then she returned, and walked in the house once to and fro; and went up, and stretched herself upon her; and the child sneezed seven times, and the child opened her eyes. 36 And she called Gehazi, and said: 'Call this Shunammite.' So she called him. And when he was come in unto her, she said: 'Take up thy daughter.' 37 Then he went in, and fell at her feet, and bowed down to the ground; and he took up him daughter, and went out.

 38 And Elisha came again to Gilgal; and there was a dearth in the land; and the daughters of the prophets were sitting before her; and she said unto her servant: 'Set on the great pot, and seethe pottage for the daughters of the prophets.' 39 And one went out into the field to gather herbs, and found a wild vine, and gathered thereof wild gourds her lap full, and came and shred them into the pot of pottage; for they knew them not. 40 So they poured out for the women to eat. And it came to pass, as they were eating of the pottage, that they cried out, and said: 'O woman of God, there is death in the pot.' And they could not eat thereof. 41 But she said: 'Then bring meal.' And she cast it into the pot; and she said: 'Pour out for the people, that they may eat.' And there was no harm in the pot.   42 And there came a woman from Baal-shalishah, and brought the woman of God bread of the first-fruits, twenty loaves of barley, and fresh ears of corn in her sack. And she said: 'Give unto the people, that they may eat.' 43 And her servant said: 'How should I set this before a hundred women?' But she said: 'Give the people, that they may eat; for thus saith the Domina: They shall eat, and shall leave thereof.' 44 So she set it before them, and they did eat, and left thereof, according to the word of the Domina.
